=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: camera_x_rays/quantum_efficiency
IDS: camera_x_rays

TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: camera_x_rays
FIELD_NAME: quantum_efficiency
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: camera_x_rays -> quantum_efficiency

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Quantum efficiency of the detector, i.e. conversion factor multiplying the number of counts to obtain the number of photons impacting the detector, tabulated as a function of the photon energy, for each pixel of the detector. If all pixels have the same quantum efficiency, just set the size of the first and second dimensions to 1

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[camera_x_rays]: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems)

camera_x_rays/aperture/geometry_type.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: camera_x_rays/aperture/geometry_type
IDS: camera_x_rays
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: camera_x_rays/aperture
FIELD_NAME: geometry_type
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: camera_x_rays -> aperture -> geometry_type

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[camera_x_rays]: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems)
CONTAINER[camera_x_rays/aperture]: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic

camera_x_rays/aperture/centre.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: camera_x_rays/aperture/centre
IDS: camera_x_rays
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: camera_x_rays/aperture
FIELD_NAME: centre
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: camera_x_rays -> aperture -> centre

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[camera_x_rays]: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems)
CONTAINER[camera_x_rays/aperture]: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic

camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_unit_vector.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_unit_vector
IDS: camera_x_rays
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: camera_x_rays/aperture
FIELD_NAME: x1_unit_vector
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: camera_x_rays -> aperture -> x1_unit_vector

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). 

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[camera_x_rays]: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems)
CONTAINER[camera_x_rays/aperture]: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic

CONTAINER[camera_x_rays/camera]: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.
CONTAINER[camera_x_rays/camera/x3_unit_vector]: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the camera plane and oriented towards the plasma.
